translation: vol. 2

source_sentence: 大唐三藏法師義淨奉　制譯
translation: Translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Yijing of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 「爾時四王子，與諸人眾漸漸前行，至雪山下弶伽河側，近劫比羅仙人所住之處。
translation: "It was then that the fourth prince and the crowd gradually traveled down the snowy mountain to the side of the Nāgas River near where the sage Kapila was staying.

source_sentence: 時四王子與諸人眾，各剪茅草以為屋舍，依此而住，爾時眾人共相採捕以自養活。
translation: The fourth prince and the others then cut thatch and made a hut for themselves, and they lived there, while the people gathered fish together to feed themselves.

source_sentence: 時四王子，日日三時往劫比羅仙所，親近供養。
translation: The four princes then went to Sage Kapila three times a day to get close to him and make offerings.

source_sentence: 四王子等年既長大，而無妻妾形體羸瘦，仙人問曰：『汝等何因漸加憔悴？』
translation: When the four princes had grown old and had no wives or concubines, they were physically emaciated, and the sage asked, 'Why are you gradually becoming more and more emaciated?'

source_sentence: 王子答曰：『我等少年無有妻妾，日夜憂愁豈不憔悴？』
translation: The prince answered, 'We boys have no wives or concubines, so wouldn't we pine away day and night in sorrow?'

source_sentence: 時仙報曰：『汝等之妹互相配適。』
translation: The seer reported, 'Your sisters are suitable for each other.'

source_sentence: 王子白曰：『我等不知合得以不？』
translation: The prince said, 'We don't know if we're compatible.'

source_sentence: 仙人報曰：『既不同母，通許此事。』
translation: The sage replied, 'Since they don't have the same mother, they'll accept this.'

source_sentence: 爾時王子各自思惟：『我等兄弟既離本國，此處無人可為婚對，仙人此教甚適我願。』
translation: Each of the princes then thought, 'Since our brothers have left our country, there's no one here to marry, and this teaching from the sage is quite suitable for my wishes.'

source_sentence: 即大歡喜，互相嫁娶以成夫婦，未久之間各生男女。
translation: They rejoiced greatly and married each other to become husband and wife, and before long each had a son and a daughter.

source_sentence: 時四王子心生喜慶，將其妻子頻至仙所，因茲便生諠鬧。
translation: The four princes were delighted and brought their wives to the sage often, and a disturbance arose because of that.

source_sentence: 仙見是已心不得定，告王子曰：『汝當安此好住，我離斯處。』
translation: Seeing this, the sage's mind was unsettled, and he told the prince, 'You must stay here well, for I'll leave this place.'

source_sentence: 王子白曰：『何故即去？』
translation: The prince said, 'Why are you leaving?'

source_sentence: 仙人報曰：『汝等諠鬧亂我禪定，猶如跣脚踏棘刺上。』
translation: The sage answered, 'You disturb my meditation like bare feet on a thorn.'

source_sentence: 王子白曰：『願仙住此，可與我等別覓好處，我當住彼。』
translation: The prince said, 'May the sage stay here, or may he find another good place with us, and I will stay there.'

source_sentence: 仙曰：『可爾！』
translation: The sage said, 'Yes!'

source_sentence: 時彼仙人有神通力，隨其所樂皆得成就，即持金瓶盛滿中水，詣餘好處洒水為界。
translation: That sage, who had supernormal powers and could achieve anything he pleased, took a golden vial full of medium-sized water and went to some other nice place and sprinkled water over the border.

source_sentence: 告王子曰：『汝等可於此地安止。』
translation: He told the princes, 'You may stay here.'

source_sentence: 時諸王子奉仙人教已，即築城壁止住其內，彼仙人灑水為界，因此立名，為劫比羅城。
translation: After the princes had been instructed by the sage, they built a wall to stop inside the city, and the sage sprinkled water to make a border, thus creating a name for it, Kappila City.

source_sentence: 百姓漸多城先窄小，時有天神見此事已，便指餘處其地寬廣，即就此處別立一城，因號此城，名為天示。
translation: As the population grew larger, the city was first narrowed, but then some god saw this and pointed out another place where the ground was wide and established a separate city there, which was called this city and was called Tianshui.

source_sentence: 時諸王子總集籌議：『為我父王娶後妻故，令我兄弟出離本國。
translation: The princes then assembled together and discussed, 'My father's marriage to his queen caused my brothers to leave our country.

source_sentence: 我等諸人應共立契，自今以後唯娶一婦更不娶餘。』
translation: We should all make a compact that from now on we'll marry only one woman and no one else.'

source_sentence: 爾時增長王問群臣曰：『我之四子今何所在？』
translation: The growing king then asked the ministers, 'Where are my four sons now?'

source_sentence: 群臣報曰：『王諸子等因有過故，王令出國，并諸姊妹。
translation: The ministers reported, 'The king's sons and sisters were sent out of the country because of a mistake the king made.

source_sentence: 今者見在雪山之下天示城中自廣營城邑。』
translation: Now, we see that they've built their own fortress in the city of Tianshui under Mount Snow.'

source_sentence: 增長王曰：『我諸子等豈能如此自成就不？』
translation: King Zongyang said, 'How could my sons and I have accomplished this on our own?'

source_sentence: 群臣報曰：『能。』
translation: The ministers answered, 'Yes!'

source_sentence: 時增長王即大踊躍，端坐舉手告諸臣曰：『我子大能！
translation: The growing king then greatly rejoiced, sat down and raised his hand, and told the ministers, 'My son is very capable!'

source_sentence: 我子大能！』
translation: 'My son is mighty!'

source_sentence: 由大威德言大能大能故，得釋迦名。
translation: Because of his great authority and words, he became very powerful and effective and was given the name Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 後於異時，增長王崩，愛樂太子即紹立為王。
translation: At some point later, when King Growler collapsed, Prince Ailuo was installed as king.

source_sentence: 「時愛樂王亦無子息，後便命終。
translation: "King Ārya was also childless at the time, and then he died.

source_sentence: 爾時群臣相共諮議，往天示城，冊第一王子名曰炬面以為國主，子息便死。
translation: At the time, a group of ministers consulted with each other and went to the city of Tiṣya to name the first prince Torchface as lord of the kingdom, and his children then died.

source_sentence: 炬面無子，後便命終，復冊大耳以為國主。
translation: When Torchface had no sons, his life ended, and he was then named Ululu as lord of the kingdom.

source_sentence: 大耳無子，復便命終，復便冊象行以為國主。
translation: When Ululu was childless, his life again ended, and he then registered Elephant Walk as lord of the kingdom.

source_sentence: 象行無子，復冊寶釧以為國主。
translation: When Elephant Walk had no sons, he then registered Baochuan as lord of the kingdom.

source_sentence: 寶釧有子，名近寶釧，後紹王位。
translation: Baochuan had a son named Kapphiṇa and was subsequently installed as king.

source_sentence: 近寶釧有子，名曰天門亦紹王位。
translation: A son named Tianmen, who was close to Baochuan, also assumed the throne.

source_sentence: 「復次諸仁！
translation: "Furthermore, you!

source_sentence: 其天門王，於劫比羅大城子孫相繼，經五萬五千代正法治國，其最後王名曰十車，十車有子名曰百車，百車有子名曰嚴車，嚴車有子名曰勝車，勝車有子名曰堅車，堅車有子名曰十弓，十弓有子名曰百弓，百弓有子名曰九十弓，九十弓有子名曰最勝弓，最勝弓有子名曰嚴弓，嚴弓有子名曰堅弓。
translation: That king of the celestials, who had descendants in the great city of Kapilavastu, passed 55,000 generations and correctly ruled the country, and his last king was named Ten Chariots, Ten Chariots had sons named Hundred Chariots, Hundred Chariots had sons named Yan Chariots, Yan Chariots had sons named Victory Chariots, Victory Chariots had sons named Resolute Chariots, Resolute Chariots had sons named Ten Bows, Ten Bows had sons named Hundred Bows, Hundred Bows had sons named Ninetieth Bows, Ninetieth Bows had sons named Most Victory Bows, Most Victory Bows had sons named Yan Bows, and Yan Bows had sons named Resolute Bows.

source_sentence: 「復次諸仁！
translation: "Furthermore, you [might] order them!

source_sentence: 其堅弓王而有二子：一名師子頰、二名師子吼。
translation: "The resolute archer king has two sons: one named Shizi Cheeks and the other Shizi Ho.

source_sentence: 此贍部洲所有一切善射之者，師子頰王最為上首。
translation: Of all the people on Jambudvīpa who are good at archery, Shizi Cheeks is the king who's the best.

source_sentence: 其師子頰王而有四子：一名淨飯、二名白飯、三名斛飯、四名甘露飯。
translation: The lion-cheeked king had four sons: one pure rice, two white rice, three tubs of rice, and four nectarine rice.

source_sentence: 師子頰王復有四女：一名清淨、二名純白、三名純斛、四名甘露。
translation: Again, the lion-cheeked king had four daughters: one pure, two pure white, three pure tubs, and four named Amṛtôdana.

source_sentence: 淨飯王有二子：其最大太子，即我薄伽梵是；其第二者，即具壽難陀是。
translation: The pure-rice king had two sons: the eldest, who was I, the Bhagavān, and the second, who was Kauṇḍinandha.

source_sentence: 白飯王有二子：一名恒星、二名賢善。
translation: The White Rice King had two sons: one named Everest and two named Goodness.

source_sentence: 斛飯王有二子：一名大名、二名阿那律。
translation: King Dravya had two sons: one was Mahānāman and the other was Aniruddha.

source_sentence: 甘露飯王有二子：一名慶喜、二名天授！
translation: The Amṛta-vana king had two sons: one who rejoiced, and the other who was given the name of Śiva!

source_sentence: 其清淨女誕生一子，名曰善悟。
translation: That pure woman gives birth to a son named Shanwu.

source_sentence: 純白有子，名曰有鬘。
translation: Pure White had a son named Arigatou.

source_sentence: 純斛有子，名曰勝力。
translation: Purity has a son named Prabhūtaratna.

source_sentence: 甘露有子，名曰大力。
translation: Amṛtôdhi has a son named Vigorous Power.

source_sentence: 我薄伽梵有子，名曰羅怙羅。
translation: I, the Bhagavān, have a son named Rāhula.

source_sentence: 始從地主大王乃至羅睺羅斷其繼嗣。
translation: From the great lord of the land up to Rāhula, we've cut off his line of succession.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以羅睺羅證無生果，斷生死種故，為此斷其繼嗣。」
translation: It's because Rāhula realized the fruit of nonproduction and ended the seeds of birth-and-death that he cut off his heirs for this reason."

source_sentence: 尊者大目健連為諸釋種大眾說其釋迦族已，便即退坐默然而住。
translation: After speaking to the Śākyamuni community about their Śākyamuni lineage, Venerable Dame Dammakārin withdrew to sit in silence.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知大目連說種族已，便從臥起端身而坐，告大目連曰：「善哉，善哉！
translation: Knowing that Mahāmaudgalyāyana had spoken about this race, the Bhagavān then got up from his bed and sat upright, telling Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝為諸苾芻，說我釋迦昔世以來所有種類。」
translation: For the monks, explain to them all the varieties of Śākyamuni that have existed since ancient times."

source_sentence: 如法說已，復告目連曰：「若復有人，為他廣說釋迦種族，此善男子於長夜中得大利益恒受安樂。」
translation: After teaching it this way, he also told Maudgalyāyana, "If someone were to explain the Śākyamuni lineage in detail for others, this good man would attain great benefit and constant comfort during the long night."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊重復告諸大眾苾芻、苾芻尼曰：「汝等當知！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the masses of monks and nuns, "You should know this!

source_sentence: 應受我昔世以來釋迦種族所在餘方，如法憶念、為他廣說。
translation: You should accept that since ages ago, the Śākyas have lived in other places, remembering the teaching as it is and explaining it for others.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 能於汝等獲大利益。
translation: "It will be of great benefit to you.

source_sentence: 具利義故、具法義故、具梵行故，當得如上所有功德。
translation: Because you possess the meaning of benefit, because you possess the meaning of the teaching, and because you possess the religious practice, you will attain all of the above merits.

source_sentence: 是故汝等苾芻！
translation: Therefore, you monks!

source_sentence: 應當受持讀誦為他廣說。」
translation: You must memorize, recite, and explain it in detail for others."

source_sentence: 爾時劫比羅城中諸釋種等，聞此本族次第說已，皆大歡喜，即從座起頂禮佛足，各還本處。
translation: After hearing this in order from our own family, the Śākyas in Kapilavastu rejoiced greatly as they rose from their seats, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, and returned to their original places.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊復告諸苾芻等：「汝等諦聽！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the monks again, "Listen closely, you!

source_sentence: 昔時師子頰王，於劫比羅城正法化人，於其國土甚大豐熟、無有恐怖、人眾歡樂。
translation: Once upon a time, the lion-cheeked king rightly taught people in the city of Kapilavastu, and his land was very productive, without fear, and his people were happy.

source_sentence: 其善悟王，於天示城正法化人，國土安隱、家給年豐、無有衰惱。
translation: That King Shanwu taught people the right Dharma in the city of Tianshui, and his land was peaceful, his family had an abundance of years, and he had no trouble.

source_sentence: 善悟王后名曰妙勝，顏貌端正眾所樂見，一切有情恒得安樂。
translation: The queen of King Shanwu is named Sumeru, and her features are so correct that people are delighted to see her, and all sentient beings are constantly at ease.

source_sentence: 天示城中有一長者名曰吉祥，甚多財寶倉庫盈溢，園林田宅其數不少，多諸眷屬，所有珍財如薜室羅末拏等無有異。
translation: In the city of Tianshui, there was an elder named Auspicious who had a vast storehouse full of treasures, a park with numerous fields and mansions, and many retinues with treasures as great as Vaiśravaṇa's. There was nothing different about that elder.

source_sentence: 時彼長者有一芳園，多諸花果流泉浴池，種種諸鳥出和雅聲，世所殊絕。
translation: That elder then had a fragrant garden with many flowers and fruits, a spring-fed bath, and a variety of birds that produced a harmonious sound that was unmatched in the world.

source_sentence: 國王王子及諸妃后常往遊戲。
translation: The king's princes and queens often went there to play.

source_sentence: 時王夫人見此園林即生貪愛，白其王曰：『此園甚好，可乞我來。』
translation: When the king's wife saw this garden, she fell in love with it and said to the king, 'This garden is very nice; ask me to come.'

source_sentence: 王即報曰：『今此園者，是長者所有，我今安得輒持與汝？
translation: The king then replied, 'This garden belongs to an elder, so how could I easily give it to you now?'

source_sentence: 汝必須者，我於城內別自修造，勝於此園，與汝遊戲。』
translation: If you must, I'll build a separate garden within the city that's superior to this one and give it to you for play.'

source_sentence: 爾時其王為夫人故，於王城內即造一園，倍勝前者，以此園林為妙勝夫人所造故，因名此園號為妙勝。
translation: For the sake of his wife, the king then built a park inside the king's city that was twice as nice as the one before it, and because this park was made by Lady Myōshō, he called it Myōshō.

source_sentence: 師子頰王恒自思念：『常乞一願，若得我種之內出一金輪王，甚適我願。』
translation: The lion cheek king always thought to himself, 'I always ask for one vow, 'If I could have a golden wheel-turning king emerge from my seeds, it would be quite suitable for my wishes.'

source_sentence: 其善悟王亦乞一願：『願我得與師子頰王速為眷屬，甚適我願。』
translation: The well-awakened king also asked for one vow, 'May I quickly become an affiliate of the lion-cheeked king, which would be very suitable for my wishes.'

source_sentence: 時善悟王最大夫人，因即懷胎，滿足十月誕生一女，顏容端正世所希有。
translation: The eldest wife of King Shanwu then was conceived and gave birth to a daughter with a beautiful face that's unmatched in the world.

source_sentence: 由此王女甚端嚴故，王及夫人後宮眷屬一切見者無不怪仰，共相議曰：『今此王女，為是人生？
translation: Because of this, the king's daughter was so dignified that the king and his wife's retinue and their retinue all looked up to each other and discussed, 'Now, is this the king's daughter born?'

source_sentence: 為是善巧天來之所化作？』
translation: Is this what the Skilful Ones have created?"

source_sentence: 經三七日，即如國法作諸喜慶，令諸群臣遞相籌議：『今與此女作何名字？』
translation: After three or seven days, he made the country rejoice according to the rules and caused the ministers to discuss the matter with each other, saying, 'What will be the name of this woman?'

source_sentence: 諸臣白曰：『此天示城中咸相謂曰：「由此王女先業果報，得此端正。」
translation: The ministers said, 'This god showed the city and said, 'This is the result of the king's daughter's prior actions, which have led to her being so correct.'

source_sentence: 復相議曰：「今此王女非人能生，是善巧天之所化作。」』
translation: They also discussed it with each other, saying, 'Now, this king's daughter isn't something that humans can produce; she's the creation of a skillful god.'

source_sentence: 咸白王曰：『可名此女號為幻化。』
translation: They all said to the king, 'We can call this woman an illusion.'

source_sentence: 即為此女，令八乳母共相養育，至漸長大時，占相師來白王曰：『今王聖女後必生兒，具足諸相有大威德，得力輪位。』
translation: They then had eight nursemaids nurture her together, and when she grew up, the fortune teller came to the king and said, 'Now, the king's noble daughter will surely give birth to a son who will be fully endowed with features and great authority and will attain the position of wheel of strength.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語甚大歡喜。
translation: The king was greatly delighted to hear this.

source_sentence: 後善悟王最大夫人更復懷妊，十月滿足誕生一女，其女身光明徹城內，容顏相好世所無比。
translation: Later, King Shanwu's eldest wife went on to have another pregnancy, and in the tenth month of pregnancy she gave birth to a daughter whose body was radiant and penetrated the city, and whose features were unsurpassed in the world.

source_sentence: 至三七日作喜慶已，即集群臣議其名字，以此小女勝幻化故，因即立名為大幻化。
translation: After rejoicing for thirty-one days, he gathered a group of ministers to discuss her name, and because this little girl was a superior illusion, he named her Great Illusion.

source_sentence: 復為此女令八乳母共相養育，漸至長大時，占相師來白王言：『今王聖女後必生兒，具三十二大丈夫相，威德尊重，至轉輪王位。』
translation: He also had eight nursemaids nurture her together, and when she grew up, a fortune teller came to the king and said, 'Now, the king's noble daughter will surely give birth to a son who will have the characteristics of thirty-two great men and whose authority and virtue will be so great that he'll reach the position of wheel-turning king.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語倍懷歡喜。
translation: The king was overjoyed at hearing this.

source_sentence: 時善悟王即令使者持書詣師子頰王，報其王曰：『我大夫人誕生二女，其最長者生誕之日，顏貌端正世所希有，相師占之，後當生子得力輪位。
translation: King Shanwu then had his messengers bring a writing to the king of the lion's cheeks and tell him, 'My eldest wife has given birth to two daughters, the eldest of whom was born with a beautiful face that's unmatched in the world, and her fortune teller predicted that she would later give birth to a son who would attain the position of wheel-turning power.

source_sentence: 其小女者身光倍勝，相師占之，後必生子得轉輪位。
translation: The youngest daughter has a body that's twice as radiant, and her fortune teller predicts that she will give birth to a son who will attain the position of wheel-turner.

source_sentence: 我聞大王有最長子名曰淨飯，二女之中願以一女為淨飯妃，故令使報。』
translation: I've heard that the king has a longest-standing son named Jōtoku, and that he wants one of the two daughters to be Jōtoku's consort, so he's asked to give her a reward.'

source_sentence: 至彼具陳，王聞此言甚大歡喜，令使還國報善悟王曰：『王之二女皆具相好，我今總取為淨飯妃。
translation: When he arrived at Gucheng, the king was overjoyed at what he heard and ordered his envoy to return to the country to report to King Shanwu, saying, 'The king's two daughters both have good features, so now I'll always take them as my consort, Jōtoku.

source_sentence: 然我先王而有要誓，不取二妃，今且取其小女生輪王者，其大女者且勿令嫁，待我集諸群臣及諸眷屬籌議此事。』
translation: However, the king before me had made a vow not to take two wives, so now I'll take the younger one, who's a wheel-turning king, and don't give the older one in marriage until I gather my ministers and retinues to discuss this matter.'

source_sentence: 時善悟王聞是語已，即以國法莊嚴小女，并令五百婇女圍繞侍從，至彼國已與淨飯王為妃。
translation: After hearing those words, King Shanwu adorned the youngest daughter with the Dharma of his kingdom and surrounded her with five hundred women to serve her.

source_sentence: 「爾時師子頰國王，有一輔庸之國，居山谷內，名般茶婆，忽然反叛，抄掠劫害隣近諸國。
translation: "At the time, the king of the lion's cheeks had a secondary state called Pañcābha that lived in a valley and suddenly rebelled, plundering and pillaging neighboring states.

source_sentence: 時隣境住人諸釋迦種，被其侵逼，互相犇馳告師子頰：『我等村落，皆被某賊日夜侵害，願王興兵親往降伏。』
translation: The people of the neighboring lands, the Śākya clan, were being attacked by them, and they rushed to tell Shizi Cheeks, 'Our villages are being attacked day and night by some bandit; may the king raise an army to personally subdue them.'

source_sentence: 師子頰王曰：『我今年老不任鬪戰。』
translation: King Shizi Cheeks said, 'I'm too old to fight this year.'

source_sentence: 彼諸人曰：『請王太子淨飯往彼捕捉。』
translation: The men said, 'Would the king ask the prince to give us clean food and go capture it?'

source_sentence: 王即報曰：『汝諸人等，若許太子求一願者，我便發遣。』
translation: The king then reported, 'All of you, if you grant the prince one wish, I will send it.'

source_sentence: 眾答王曰：『唯然隨命。』
translation: The people replied to the king, 'Yes, as you wish.'

source_sentence: 時師子頰王於其城中擊鼓宣令，嚴勅四兵隨從太子，往彼討罰。
translation: The king of the lion's cheeks then beat a drum in his city and announced that he would order his four soldiers to follow the prince and punish him there.

source_sentence: 爾時淨飯太子奉持父命，將領四兵至彼賊所共相戰害。
translation: Then, Prince Jōtan, in accordance with his father's order, led the four soldiers to the bandits and fought them together.

source_sentence: 以威力故，時彼賊眾，被太子軍或殺或縛，無有遺櫱。
translation: Because of their authority, the pirates were killed or bound by the prince's army, and there were no survivors.

source_sentence: 賊既除滅，淨飯太子即領其軍還歸本國。
translation: After the bandits were removed, Prince Jīvaka then led his army back to his homeland.

source_sentence: 時諸釋種既得太子平除賊已，皆大踊躍而白王言：『淨飯太子為除怨害。』
translation: After the prince had pacified the bandits, the ascetics all rejoiced and said to the king, 'Prince Jōtan has removed the enemy.'

source_sentence: 臣等諸人不勝喜慶：『王之先言：「太子有願。」
translation: We ministers were overjoyed, saying, 'The king had first said, 'The prince has a wish.

source_sentence: 請王為臣等說。』
translation: Please, king, explain this for us!'

source_sentence: 時師子頰王告諸釋曰：『汝釋迦種，先立言誓不取二妻。』
translation: Then the lion king addressed the Śākyas, saying, 'You Śākya sons, you promised not to take two wives.'

source_sentence: 諸釋迦曰：『王今豈欲解先誓耶？』
translation: The Śākyas said, 'Does the king now want to understand that prior vow?'

source_sentence: 王曰：『不然！
translation: The king said, 'No!

source_sentence: 更須牢結。
translation: "Again, he must be firmly bound.

source_sentence: 然我意者，唯為淨飯太子取其二妃，餘不應取。』
translation: Still, it's my intention to take only the two wives of Prince Jīvaka and not the others.'

source_sentence: 諸釋迦曰：『此事可爾。』
translation: The Śākyas said, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 時師子頰王即令使者往善悟王所，而告之曰：『我今與諸釋迦種等共相籌議，咸皆許我為淨飯太子取王長女為妃，王可與我。』
translation: The king of the lion's cheeks then sent a messenger to King Shanwu and told him, 'Now, I've been talking with a group of Śākyas, and they've all agreed that I should take the king's eldest daughter as my consort for Prince Jīvaka, so the king can give her to me.'

source_sentence: 王聞語已甚大歡喜，即以五百婇女為其侍從，種種珍服莊嚴女身，送劫比羅國。
translation: When the king heard what they said, he was overjoyed and sent 500 of his daughters to Kapilavastu as his attendants, adorned them in various kinds of clothing, and sent them to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時師子頰王得其女至，即如國法，會諸群臣作倡伎樂，納娶其女為太子妃。
translation: When he got his daughter, the king met his ministers, created music, and accepted her as the prince's consort, just as the country had taught.

source_sentence: 未久之間師子頰崩，以其淨飯太子後繼父位。
translation: Before long, Shizi Cheeks died, and he succeeded his father as the prince of his pure rice.

source_sentence: 正法化人，國土安樂、五穀豐熟、無諸衰惱，其國人眾處處充滿。
translation: When the right Dharma transforms people, their land is peaceful and happy, the grains are plentiful, there's no trouble, and the people of their country are filled with people everywhere.

source_sentence: 於異時中，與大幻化夫人登諸樓閣，後宮婇女圍遶侍衛，奏諸女樂縱逸遊戲。
translation: At another time, he and the great conjured lady ascended into a tower, surrounded by women in the rear palace, and guarded by them, playing the music of women in their careers.

source_sentence: 「菩薩若在覩史多天，常有五法觀察世間。
translation: "If a bodhisattva were in the Tushita Heaven, he'd always have five ways of observing the world.

source_sentence: 何謂五法？
translation: What are the five things?

source_sentence: 一者觀察生處、二者觀察國土、三者觀察時節、四者觀察種族、五者觀察所生父母。
translation: One observes the place of birth, two observes the land, three observes the season, four observes the family, and five observes the parents who are born.

source_sentence: 何故菩薩觀察生處？
translation: Why do bodhisattvas observe the place of birth?

source_sentence: 在覩史多天宮，常作是念：『過去菩薩何處受生？』
translation: At the palace of Tuṣita, he always thought, 'Where were the bodhisattvas born in the past?'

source_sentence: 便即觀見，或於淨行婆羅門家生、或於剎帝利貴種家生、或為婆羅門師、或為剎帝利師故。
translation: He then sees that he'll be born in a pure and practicing Brahmin family, or in a noble family of a Bāṭī, or as a Brahmin teacher or a Bāṭī teacher.

source_sentence: 『當今之時，剎利為尊，我當往彼剎利家生。
translation: 'At the present time, the bhadra is the most honored, so I will go to be born in one of those bhadra's homes.'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若我於彼貧下家生者，或有來世眾生，誹謗我故。』
translation: If I were to be born in that poor family, perhaps there will be sentient beings in a future life who would denigrate me.'

source_sentence: 由此因緣，菩薩以自在福力，隨其所念皆得生彼。
translation: As a result of this, the bodhisattva, by virtue of his sovereign merit, will be born there according to his thoughts.

source_sentence: 由此義故，菩薩受生之時，先當觀察所生之處。
translation: For this reason, when a bodhisattva is given birth, he or she must first examine the place where he or she will be born.

source_sentence: 何故菩薩觀察國土，菩薩在覩史多天，常作是念：『過去菩薩生何國土？』
translation: Why is it that when the bodhisattva observes the land, the bodhisattva always thinks this in the Tushita Heaven, 'What land was the bodhisattva born in in the past?'

source_sentence: 即見彼國，有甘蔗、粳米、大麥、小麥、黃牛、水牛，家家充滿，乞食易得，無有十惡、多修十善。
translation: He then saw that there was sugarcane, millet, barley, wheat, yellow oxen, and water buffalo in that country, that every family was full of them, that it was easy to get alms food, and that there were no ten bad qualities and many cultivators of the ten good qualities.

source_sentence: 菩薩思惟：『中天竺國如是等物悉皆具足故，我今生彼中天竺國。
translation: The bodhisattva thinks, 'Such things are all abundant in the country of Central India, so now I've been born there in Central India.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若生邊地者，或時有情誹謗我故。』
translation: If someone is born in a marginal land, it's because some sentient beings sometimes denigrate me.'

source_sentence: 是故菩薩以福德力，隨其所念皆得生彼，如佛所說無有虛也。
translation: Because of this, a bodhisattva's merit will allow him to be born there according to his thoughts, just as the Buddha has said, without any falsehood.

source_sentence: 何故觀察時節？
translation: Why is there a time to examine it?

source_sentence: 菩薩在覩史多天宮，常作是念：『過去菩薩於何時節下生人間？』
translation: While in the palace of Tuṣita, the bodhisattva always thought, 'When did the bodhisattvas of the past descend to the human realm?'

source_sentence: 若見彼國眾生上壽八萬歲、下壽乃至百歲，菩薩爾時來生其國。
translation: If he sees a sentient being in that country whose upper life span is 80,000 years and whose lower life span is even a hundred years, then the bodhisattva comes to be born in that country.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若人長壽八萬已上，時諸眾生無有愁苦、愚癡、頑鈍、憍慢，著樂非正法器，難受化故；若人短壽百歲已下，時諸眾生為諸五濁昏冒重故。
translation: If a person lives a long life of 80,000 years or more, then sentient beings are free from sorrow and suffering, foolishness, stubbornness, and pride, and they're attached to happiness that's not the right vessel for the Dharma and is difficult to teach; if a person lives a short life of 100 years or less, then sentient beings are burdened by the five turbidities.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者命濁、二者煩惱濁、三者有情濁、四者見濁、五者劫濁。
translation: 1. turbidity of life, 2. turbidity of afflictions, 3. turbidity of sentient beings, 4. turbidity of views, and 5. turbidity of eons.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時作是思惟：『若我惡世時出現於世，多諸外道心王誹謗，五濁增長非正法器，猶如過去一切菩薩濁惡世時不出於世。
translation: The bodhisattva then had this thought, 'If I were to appear in the world during a bad age and many non-Buddhist mind-king denigrate me, the five turbidities would grow and not be proper Dharma vessels, just as all the bodhisattvas of the past didn't come into the world during a turbid bad age.'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸佛出興所說正法，皆不虛過。』
translation: The right teachings that are produced by the buddhas are not in vain.'

source_sentence: 由是義故，觀察時節。
translation: For this reason, it's a good idea to examine the seasons.

source_sentence: 復次何故觀察種族？
translation: Furthermore, why is it necessary to examine the lineage?

source_sentence: 菩薩在覩史多天，常作是思惟：『觀察於何種族可受生者？』
translation: While in the Tushita Heaven, the bodhisattvas always thought, 'What kind of people can I observe as being eligible for birth?'

source_sentence: 若見有人先世以來，內外親族無能謗者，即生於彼。
translation: "If a person is seen to have no relatives inside or outside the world who can denigrate them since a prior life, they'll be born there.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時作是觀已，乃見釋迦清淨尊貴轉輪王種堪可出現。
translation: After observing this, the bodhisattva then sees that the Śākyamuni pure and noble lineage of wheel-turning kings can appear.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 菩薩若於下賤家生世間，有情或生誹謗。
translation: "If a bodhisattva were to be born in a world of lowly families, some sentient beings might revile him.

source_sentence: 菩薩於無量劫來，獲自在力，所有欲念皆得隨意，凡所說法曾無虛過。
translation: Since an incalculably long time ago, the bodhisattva has attained sovereignty, has been able to follow all desires, and has never falsely explained any teaching.

source_sentence: 由此因緣，菩薩觀察所生種族。
translation: It's for this reason that the bodhisattva observes the races that are born.

source_sentence: 復次何故觀所生母？
translation: "Furthermore, why does he observe the mother that's born?

source_sentence: 菩薩在覩史多天宮，作是思惟：『如餘菩薩，於何等母而受胎藏？』
translation: While in the palace of Tushita, the bodhisattva had this thought, 'Such other bodhisattvas, from what kind of mother did they receive the womb-store?'

source_sentence: 觀彼女人七世種族，悉皆清淨無有婬污，形貌端嚴善修戒品，堪任菩薩具足十月處其胎藏；而此女人，所其生業往來進止，曾無障礙。
translation: "She's a woman of seven generations, all pure and undefiled by sexual misconduct, of dignified appearance, well cultivated in the moral code, and capable of serving as a bodhisattva in the full tenth month of her life in the womb; there's never been any obstruction to this woman's progress in the karma she produces.

source_sentence: 復次大幻化夫人，曾於過去諸佛發無上願：『使我來世所生之子得成種覺。』
translation: Furthermore, the great illusory transformation woman once made the unsurpassed vow to the buddhas of the past, 'That the sons born to me in the next life may become seed awakeners.'

source_sentence: 由是諸菩薩，恐諸眾生作是謗言：『何故菩薩於彼無相女人胎中而出於世？』
translation: Because of this, bodhisattvas fear that sentient beings will say, 'Why did that bodhisattva emerge from the world in the womb of that markless woman?'

source_sentence: 是故菩薩，從無始已來種諸善根，皆悉成就。
translation: Therefore, the bodhisattvas have accomplished all the good roots they've planted since beginningless time.

source_sentence: 由是義故，菩薩觀察所生之母。
translation: For this reason, the bodhisattva observes the mother that's been born.

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩作是五種遍觀察已，即慇懃三唱告六欲天，而作是言：『我今從是覩史多天下生人間，於白淨王最大夫人胎中為其太子，誕生之後證常住果。
translation: "After he had made these five kinds of detailed observations, the bodhisattva then addressed the six heavens of desire with three invocations, saying, "Now, I was born here among the gods of Tushita, in the womb of the eldest wife of King Baishen, as her crown prince, and after her birth I realized the fruit of permanence.

source_sentence: 汝等諸天，願欲隨我證斯果者，可於人間同我生彼。』
translation: You gods who wish to follow me in realizing this fruit may be born among humans with me there.'

source_sentence: 於天眾中三告是語。
translation: He told them this three times among the gods.

source_sentence: 爾時諸天聞此語已，同聲報曰：『善哉！
translation: After the gods heard this, they all answered with one voice, 'Good!

source_sentence: 菩薩知不？
translation: Does the bodhisattva know that?

source_sentence: 彼贍部洲剛強難化多諸濁亂，外道六師及隨外道六聲聞等，并諸六定外道之類，遍滿其土，深著邪見難可拔濟。
translation: The (Jambudvīpa) continent is filled with the six masters of non-Buddhism, the six śrāvakas who follow non-Buddhists, and other types of non-Buddhists with the six concentrations, who are deeply attached to wrong views and difficult to rescue.

source_sentence: 何謂六師：一者脯剌拏、二者末揭利子、三者珊逝移毘羅胝子、四者阿市多雞舍甘婆羅、五者脚拘陀迦旃延種、六者昵揭爛陀若提子。
translation: What are the six teachers: one is Pūraṇa, two are Maudgalyāyana, three are Sañjaya-vairāṭi, four are Ājita-kauśāmbara, five are Kātyāyana-kauśāmbara, and six are Nirmāṇarati-jñāniputra.

source_sentence: 何謂六隨外道聲聞？
translation: What are the six śrāvakas who follow the non-Buddhist path?

source_sentence: 一者拘達多婆羅門、二者輸那陀、三者遮彌、四者梵壽、五者蓮實、六者赤海子。
translation: One is a Cūḍadatta brāhmaṇa, two are Śonadhas, three are Cāmīs, four are Brahmā, five are Lianzhi, and six are Akaniṣṭha.

source_sentence: 何謂六定外道？
translation: What are the six non-Buddhist meditators?

source_sentence: 一者欝多伽囉摩子、二者囉囉哥囉摩、三者善梵志、四者最勝儒童、五者黑仙、六者優樓頻螺迦葉若胝羅(唐云有多毛)。
translation: One is Uttarakuru, the other is Rāhagorāma, the third is a good priest, the fourth is a most excellent youth, the fifth is a black sage, and the sixth is Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa-Jñātīra (Tang dynasty).

source_sentence: 如是等外道邪法，教化彼諸眾生，貪著邪見難可濟度。
translation: Such are the mistaken teachings of these non-Buddhists, who teach sentient beings who are addicted to mistaken views and are difficult to save.

source_sentence: 如何菩薩今欲往彼？
translation: How would a bodhisattva like to go there now?

source_sentence: 今我覩史多宮，一一諸天聽法之座，縱廣正等十二踰膳那。
translation: 'Now, I see the palace of Stūpa, where each of the gods is seated listening to the teaching, even though it's exactly 12 yojanas wide.

source_sentence: 當我在此說法，我等聞已深生信受，能令我等於長夜中安樂利益。』
translation: When I preach the Dharma here, we'll hear it and become deeply convinced that it will give us well-being and benefit during the long night.'

source_sentence: 彼時諸天作是語已，菩薩爾時告諸天曰：『汝等諸天，宜各隨意作諸音樂。』
translation: After the gods said this, the bodhisattva then addressed the gods, 'You gods, it's appropriate for you to make music as you like.'

source_sentence: 時彼天眾即皆同時作諸音樂，其聲沸鬧。
translation: The gods then all made music at the same time, and the sound was boisterous.

source_sentence: 爾時菩薩即吹大螺，諸音樂響普皆摧息。
translation: The bodhisattva then blew the great conch, and the sound of the music was universally quelled.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時復問天曰：『諸音樂中何聲為大？』
translation: The bodhisattva then also asked the gods, 'Which of the sounds of music is loud?'

source_sentence: 諸天答曰：『螺聲最大。』
translation: The gods replied, 'The conch sounds the loudest.'

source_sentence: 『諸善男子！
translation: 'Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝等當知：如大螺聲能令一切諸音樂聲悉皆摧息，我亦如是，下於贍部洲中有所說法，能令六師外道、六隨聲聞外道、六定外道皆悉摧滅，令一切眾生得甘露法，皆悉飽滿；吹無常螺，令諸外道假常之計皆悉摧滅；吹大空螺，令諸外道執有之見亦皆摧滅。』
translation: You should know that just as the sound of a great conch causes the sound of all music to cease, so too have I spoken in the Jambudvīpa region, causing the six non-Buddhist masters, the six śrāvaka non-Buddhists, and the six non-Buddhist meditators to all perish, causing all sentient beings to attain the fullness of the nectar of the Dharma, blowing the conch of impermanence to cause the non-Buddhist conceptions of nominal permanence to all perish, and blowing the conch of great emptiness to cause the non-Buddhist views of attachment to existence to all perish.'

source_sentence: 爾時菩薩說伽他曰：「『師子能伏諸猛獸，　　金剛善摧一切堅；　　帝釋能伏阿蘇羅，　　一切光中日光勝。』
translation: The bodhisattva then spoke the verse, "The lion subdues fierce animals, the vajra well destroys all hardness, and Indra subdues asuras, the sun shines above all others."

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩說此頌已，告諸天曰：『汝等若欲清淨飽滿甘露之法，可生中天竺國六大城內。』
translation: "After speaking this verse, the bodhisattva addressed the gods, saying, 'If you want to purify the Dharma that's full of ambrosia, you can be born in the six major cities of the country of Central India.'

source_sentence: 爾時釋提桓因在於座中，作是思念：『知釋迦菩薩必託摩耶夫人胎藏之內，我當以神通力清淨其體，令無垢穢身力強健，以待菩薩。』
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra was in his seat and had this thought, 'Knowing that Śākyamuni must be placed inside Lady Māyā's womb, I will use my supernormal powers to purify his body and make it spotless and strong in anticipation of the bodhisattva.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即以通力淨彼摩耶夫人胎藏之內。
translation: After he had this thought, he then used his supernormal powers to purify the inside of that Lady Māyā's womb.

source_sentence: 菩薩爾時於覩史多天宮五種觀察，慇懃三唱告諸天已，即於夜中，如六牙白象形下於天竺，降摩耶夫人清淨胎內。
translation: After he had spoken to the gods in five ways at the palace of Tushita, the bodhisattva then descended into India at night in the shape of a six-tusked white elephant and descended into the pure womb of Mrs. Māyā.

source_sentence: 「爾時摩耶夫人，即於其夜見四種夢：一者見六牙白象來處胎中、二者見其自身飛騰虛空、三者見上高山、四者見多人眾頂禮圍繞。
translation: "At the time, Mrs. Māyā saw four kinds of dreams that night: one, a vision of a six-tusked white elephant coming into the womb, two, a vision of herself soaring through the sky, three, a vision of a high mountain, and four, a vision of a multitude of people prostrating and surrounding her.

source_sentence: 作是夢已，向淨飯王說如上事。
translation: After having this dream, he told King Jōtan the things described above.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王即召相師說其夢事，相師答曰：『如我相法，王大夫人必當生男，具足三十二丈夫之相，莊嚴其身。
translation: The king then summoned the fortune teller to tell him about the dream, and the fortune teller replied, 'According to my teaching, the king's wife will surely give birth to a man with the appearance of thirty-two husbands who will adorn her body.

source_sentence: 若紹王位，當乘金輪伏四天下；若出家修道，證法王位，名聞十方作眾生父。』」
translation: If she takes up the position of king, she'll ride the golden wheel and subdue the four worlds; if she leaves home and cultivates, she'll realize the position of king of the Dharma and be known in ten directions as the father of sentient beings.'"

source_sentence: 內攝頌曰：　我降生時，　　四天守護，　　如明月珠，　諸物纏裹；　　亦如寶線，　　智者明了，　自持五戒，　　無諸欲念。
translation: An internal verse says, 'When I was born, the four gods guarded me like a bright moon pearl that's tied up in things, or like a thread of treasure that's understood by wise men, I observed the five precepts myself and had no thoughts of desire.'

source_sentence: 「諸菩薩有常法，從覩史天下生母胎。
translation: "All bodhisattvas have the eternal Dharma of being born in their mother's womb from the world of Tuṣita.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，十方大地悉皆震動，有大光明並皆周遍，六趣眾生隨業之境，日月威光所不到處，普皆明徹。
translation: At the time, the whole earth in the ten directions shook, and there was a great bright light that completely surrounded and illuminated the realms of sentient beings in the six destinies according to their actions, wherever the sun and moon's mighty light didn't reach.

source_sentence: 其中眾生各相告曰：『今此光明得未曾有，將非我等別受生耶？』
translation: Each of those sentient beings told one another, 'Now, has this light never existed before, and won't we be born separately?'

source_sentence: 復次菩薩降母胎時，釋提桓因即遣四天王神營衛其母，而此四神：一執利刀，一執羂索，一執於戟，一執弓箭。
translation: Furthermore, when the bodhisattva descended into his mother's womb, Śakra Devānām-Indra sent four gods to guard his mother, one of whom was armed with a sharp sword, one with a noose, one with a halberd, and one with a bow and arrow.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 恐諸惡魔得其母便。
translation: "They're afraid that evil demons will get an advantage over their mothers.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩降生之時，其母胎中諸血穢等，皆悉遠離而不染著；如明月珠，雖為諸物之所纏裹，而無染污。
translation: When bodhisattvas are born, the blood and other filth in their mother's womb are all removed and don't stain them, like a bright moon pearl that's not tainted even though it's tangled up in things.

source_sentence: 菩薩在母胎時亦復如是。
translation: Bodhisattvas are likewise when they're in their mother's womb.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩常法：其母常見菩薩在其胎中，猶以青黃赤白等綿裹於淨寶，諸慧眼人見其寶綿分別曉了，母見菩薩在其胎中亦復如是。
translation: It's a constant pattern for bodhisattvas: When their mother sees a bodhisattva in the womb, she's like a blue, yellow, red, and white cotton wrapped around a pure treasure that's discerned and understood by those with discerning eyes, and so is the mother who sees the bodhisattva in the womb.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩常法：在母胎時，能令其母身體和悅無有疲乏。
translation: The constant rule for bodhisattvas is that when they're in their mother's womb, they can make her body comfortable and not weary.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩在母胎時，其母自然常持五戒：不殺、不盜、不邪行、不妄語、不飲酒。
translation: When bodhisattvas are in their mothers' wombs, their mothers naturally always observe the five precepts: don't kill, don't steal, don't engage in wrong practices, don't lie, and don't drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩常法：在其母胎，其母自然不貪欲愛。
translation: The constant rule for all bodhisattvas is that when they're in their mother's womb, their mother naturally abstains from craving and desire.

source_sentence: 復次摩耶夫人，忽自思念：『四大海水皆飲令盡。』
translation: Furthermore, Mrs. Māyā suddenly thought to herself, 'Drink all the four great waters of the ocean and make them disappear.'

source_sentence: 向淨飯王說其心願。
translation: She told King Jīvaka what she had wished.

source_sentence: 時劫比羅城中有一外道名曰赤眼，善諸幻術，王令使者喚其赤眼，說如上意。
translation: Then, there was a heretic named Red-Eye in Kapilavastu who was skilled in illusory techniques, and the king had his messengers summon Red-Eye and explain his wishes as above.

source_sentence: 赤眼報曰：『願與夫人登高樓上。』
translation: Red-eye replied, 'May I climb up a high building with you, madam?'

source_sentence: 既登樓已，即以幻術為四大海水，持其海水與夫人飲。
translation: Once they had climbed that high building, he conjured up four great rivers of water, took their water, and gave it to the lady to drink.

source_sentence: 既飲水已，爾時夫人其意即息。
translation: After she drank the water, the lady's mind then stopped.

source_sentence: 時摩耶夫人復更思念：『一切有情被繫閉者，悉令解脫。』
translation: Mrs. Māyā then also thought, 'All sentient beings who are bound and shut down will be freed.'

source_sentence: 作是思已即向王說。
translation: After thinking this, she told the king.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，即勅獄官，所有囚閉皆令放出，爾時夫人其念即息。
translation: When the king heard those words, he ordered the prison officials to release all those who had been imprisoned, and the woman's thoughts stopped.

source_sentence: 摩耶夫人又復思念：『意欲布施財物。』
translation: Again, Mrs. Māyā thought, 'I want to give away my possessions.'

source_sentence: 作是念已即向王說。
translation: After she had that thought, she told the king.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，即為布施種種財物，爾時夫人其念便息。
translation: When the king heard those words, he gave the various goods for her, and the woman's thoughts then stopped.

source_sentence: 又復思惟：『欲往苑園遊行觀望。』
translation: She also thought, 'I want to go to the garden and promenade around to look at it.'

source_sentence: 便向王說。
translation: She then spoke to the king.

source_sentence: 王聞是已，即將夫人就諸園苑觀望，其念便息。
translation: After hearing this, the king summoned the lady to look around the various parks and gardens, and her thoughts were calmed.

source_sentence: 又復生念意：『欲於父王園苑中居止。』
translation: Again, he gave rise to the thought, 'I want to stay in my father's garden.'

source_sentence: 便告王曰，王聞是語，即令使者往善悟王處報云：『今摩耶夫人，意欲就彼父王藍毘尼園中居止。』
translation: He then told the king that when he heard this, he sent a messenger to King Shanwu to report, 'Now, Lady Māyā wants to stay at her father's Lumbinī garden.'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，便即差人敷設掃洒，令摩耶夫人及諸侍從、婇女詣藍毘尼園而為遊觀。
translation: When the king heard this, he had someone clean and prepare a messenger to send Lady Māya and her attendants and daughters to the Lumbinī Garden to look around.

source_sentence: 乃見一無憂樹花葉滋茂，夫人欲生太子，便手攀其樹枝。
translation: They saw a tree without sorrow with flowers and leaves that were flourishing, and the lady wanted to give birth to a prince, so she climbed its branches with her hands.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋，知菩薩母心懷慚恥，多人眾中不能即誕其子，便作方便發大風雨，令諸人眾各自分散。
translation: Knowing that the mother of the bodhisattva was ashamed that she wouldn't be able to give birth to a son among many people, the god Śakra then made a great wind and rain that caused the people to scatter.

source_sentence: 是時帝釋，化作老嬭立夫人前，夫人即生。
translation: Śakra then transformed himself into an old mother and stood in front of her, and she was born.

source_sentence: 時天帝釋以仙衣擎取，先在腹內心多煩悶，告帝釋曰：『汝放於地。』
translation: Taking her in his sage's robe, he first put her in his belly and was troubled at heart, saying to Śakra, 'Put her on the ground.'

source_sentence: 時天帝釋暫少遠住。
translation: Śakra then stayed a short while away.

source_sentence: 「菩薩生時大地振動，天地光明乃至日月所不及處，皆令明徹。
translation: "When the bodhisattva is born, the earth shakes and the light from heaven and earth, even where the sun and moon don't reach, is made shining brightly.

source_sentence: 其中眾生皆得相見，各相謂言：『非唯我身獨在此處生，亦有餘人共在此處。』
translation: All the sentient beings therein are able to see each other and say, 'I'm not the only one who's born here, but there are others who are born here together.'

source_sentence: 一切菩薩有常法式：從胎出時，無諸濃血及餘穢惡。
translation: All bodhisattvas have the usual rule: When they emerge from the womb, there's no thick blood or other filth.

source_sentence: 其菩薩母欲產之時，不坐不臥攀樹而立，無諸苦惱後有。
translation: When the bodhisattva's mother is about to give birth, she doesn't sit or lay down and climb up a tree, so there are no painful or distressing after-effects.

source_sentence: 菩薩常法：生已在地，無人扶侍而行七步，觀察四方便作是言：『此是東方，我是一切眾生最上。
translation: The bodhisattva's constant rule: After being born on the ground, he walks seven steps without being assisted, observes the four methods, and says, 'This is the east, where I'm the most superior of all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 此是南方，我堪眾生之所供養。
translation: This is the south, where I'm an offering to all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 此是西方，我今決定不受後生。
translation: This is the west, where I'm certain I won't be subject to later birth.

source_sentence: 此是北方，我今已出生死大海。』
translation: This is the north, and now I've emerged from the ocean of birth-and-death.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸天，手持白蓋及與白拂，萃寶嚴飾覆菩薩上。
translation: At the time, the gods held white canopies and white whisks, and they covered the bodhisattva with an ornament of jewelry.

source_sentence: 諸龍王等，各持二種清淨香水，所謂冷暖調和，洗浴菩薩。
translation: The dragon kings and others each carried two kinds of pure perfume, called warm and cold, to bathe the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩常法：誕生之處，於其母前現大池水，其母所欲澡洗皆悉充足。
translation: It's a constant for all bodhisattvas: At the place of birth, a large lake of water appears in front of their mother, and whatever she desires is washed and cleansed.

source_sentence: 諸菩薩常法：誕生之時，諸天仙眾在虛空中，以種種天妙和香，末香塗香旃檀沈水，而散菩薩。
translation: The constant Dharma of the bodhisattvas: At the time of birth, a multitude of celestials scattered the bodhisattva in the sky with a variety of heavenly, wonderful, and blended incense, powdered and coated incense, and sedimentary water.

source_sentence: 種種諸天音樂，在虛空中自然發響。
translation: Various celestial sounds and music naturally resonate in the sky.

source_sentence: 「爾時阿私陀仙，在吉悉枳迷山石窟之中，彼仙恒知一切世間興衰之相。
translation: "At the time, the sage Asita was in the rock cave on Mount Gisikha, and that sage always knew all the signs of worldly prosperity and decline.

source_sentence: 其仙有一外甥名那羅陀，彼那羅陀時時而來恭敬供養。
translation: He had a nephew named Nārāditya, who came from time to time to venerate and make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 爾時仙人隨緣教示，報那羅陀曰：『彼聞仙記深信不虛，喜溢身心，求請出家而作弟子。』
translation: The immortal then instructed him according to the situation and reported to Nārādity, 'He's convinced by what he's heard of the immortal's record that it's not false, and his joy overflows in body and soul as he seeks to leave home and become a disciple.'

source_sentence: 菩薩初誕天地光明，那羅陀覩瑞，即白仙曰：『親教！
translation: When the bodhisattva first appeared in the heavens and earth, Nārāditya saw the auspicious sign and said to the sage, 'My dear, teach!'

source_sentence: 頗有惡世二日雙現以不？
translation: Could it be that there are two suns of the evil world that appear together?

source_sentence: 若無二日，何故此窟有是光明？』
translation: If there were no two suns, why would this cave have such a bright light?'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀仙，說伽他曰：「『日光極熱不明淨，　　此光明淨及清涼；　　流輝晃耀於山窟，　　我定知是牟尼光。
translation: The sage Asita then said to Gata, "The sun is extremely hot and impure, but this light is pure and cool; its radiance shines brightly in a mountain cave, and I definitely know it's Muni's light.

source_sentence: 菩薩神通大威德，　　出其母胎現此光；　　清淨明朗真金色，　　遍滿世間諸大地。』
translation: The bodhisattva's supernormal powers are so great that he emerged from his mother's womb to produce this light, which is pure, clear, and truly golden and which pervades the whole world.'

source_sentence: 「那羅陀報曰：『親教！
translation: "Then Nārada replied, 'My dear teacher!

source_sentence: 我今隨從親教欲看菩薩。』
translation: 'Now, I want to see a bodhisattva after I've been taught by my relatives.'

source_sentence: 時仙告曰：『汝今知不？
translation: The recluse then told him, 'Do you know now?'

source_sentence: 彼之菩薩有大威德，天龍八部之所圍遶，我等往彼不可得見。
translation: That bodhisattva has great authority and is surrounded by gods, dragons, and the eight groups of gods, and we can't go there and see him.

source_sentence: 若彼菩薩入劫比羅城三號已，然後我往可見菩薩。』
translation: If that bodhisattva enters Kapila's city three times, then I'll go there and see the bodhisattva.'

source_sentence: 菩薩生時，五百宮人各生一男，謂贊鐸迦而為上首。
translation: When the bodhisattva was born, each of the five hundred people in the palace gave birth to a male, who was called Zandaka and was the leader.

source_sentence: 五百宮人各生一女，旃尼而為上首。
translation: Each of the five hundred people in the palace gave birth to a woman, named Kāṇḍānī, who was the head.

source_sentence: 五百大臣各生一男，鄔陀夷而為上首。
translation: Five hundred ministers each gave birth to a boy, and Udayinī was made the head.

source_sentence: 有五百象各生一子，報灑陀子而為上首。
translation: To each of the five hundred elephants, a son was born, and Ghoṣadāja was made the head.

source_sentence: 五百馬各生一子，馬囉呵馬子而為上首。
translation: Five hundred horses each give birth to a son, and Mahārāmaja is the head.

source_sentence: 五百寶藏自開出現，四方諸國王等悉皆降伏，常獻種種雜物而來奉事。
translation: When the five hundred jeweled treasures open up on their own, the kings of the four directions are all subjugated, and they always offer various sundry goods to serve them.

source_sentence: 爾時大臣見是相已，來白大王。
translation: After the minister saw this, he came to the king and told him about it.

source_sentence: 王聞此事便深思念：『我今此子，成就一切諸善事業。』
translation: When the king heard this, he thought deeply, 'Now, this son of mine has accomplished all kinds of good deeds.'

source_sentence: 因此大王號此太子，名為成就一切事，是故菩薩初得此名。
translation: The king therefore called this prince, 'Accomplished in all works,' which is why the bodhisattva first attained this name.

source_sentence: 「時劫比羅城有一藥叉，名為釋迦增長，城內若有釋迦族類，生得男女，先將向彼藥叉而為作禮。
translation: "At the time, there was a Yakṣa in Kapilavastu who was named Śākyamuni, and if there were any members of the Śākyamuni clan in the city who had been born as boys or girls, they would first pay homage to that Yakṣa.

source_sentence: 時彼大王便勅臣佐，將其太子往增長釋迦藥叉處，遣作禮拜。
translation: The great king then ordered his ministers to send the prince to the growing Śākyamuni and send him to pay homage to him.

source_sentence: 臣得王教，以七寶輦輿安置太子，往詣藥叉之處。
translation: The ministers got the king's instructions, placed the prince in a seven-jeweled palanquin, and went to Yakṣa's place.

source_sentence: 劫比羅城諸釋種等，性懷獷烈心意兇猛，多起人我堅鞕惡暴。
translation: The Śākyas of Kapilavastu are harsh and fierce in nature, and they often become hardened and violent in their belief in self.

source_sentence: 見彼菩薩皆悉寂靜，默然而住。
translation: Seeing that the bodhisattvas were all quiescent, they waited silently.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王作思念曰：『此住劫比羅城諸釋種等，性懷獷烈心意兇暴，多起人我堅鞕惡性，彼見太子入城，皆如牟尼默然而住。
translation: The king of Jīvaka then had a thought, 'Those ascetics living in Kapilavastu are harsh and violent in nature, and they often give rise to the hard and unyielding temperament of person and self, but when they see the prince enter the city, they all stand silent like a muni.

source_sentence: 以此緣故，可呼太子名為釋迦牟尼。』
translation: For this reason, they may call the prince Śākyamuni.'

source_sentence: 時釋迦牟尼菩薩至藥叉廟所，彼釋迦增長藥叉遙見菩薩漸近廟所，即從座起五體投地頂禮菩薩。
translation: When the Śakyamuni Bodhisattva arrived at the temple of Yakṣa, that Śākyamuni and Yakṣa saw the Bodhisattva approaching the temple from a distance, and they got up from their seats and bowed their heads with five bodies to the ground to the Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 眾人見已甚大驚怪，即往淨飯王所白言：『大王！
translation: They were very surprised by what they saw, so they went to King Jīvaka and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今藥叉神遙見太子，從廟而出頂禮雙足。』
translation: Now, the god Yakṣa sees the prince from a distance and comes out of the temple to bow with his head and feet.'

source_sentence: 時王聞已甚大歡喜，作如是言：『若天神禮拜太子故，知是天中天。
translation: The king was greatly elated when he heard that, and he said, 'If the gods venerate the prince, they know he's a god among gods.

source_sentence: 以此緣故，號為天中天。』
translation: For this reason, they're called gods of gods.'

source_sentence: 「時彼大王即將太子還於本宮，令宮乳母依時養育。
translation: "That great king then returned the prince to his palace and had his palace nursemaids nurture him according to time.

source_sentence: 彼乳母等甚大歡喜，即以雙手，於父王邊捧受太子，在宮閣內勤加養育。
translation: They rejoiced greatly, so they took the prince in both hands next to his father and nurtured him inside the palace.

source_sentence: 彼乳母等，每日香湯洗浴，塗妙好香種種莊嚴，每日將向王所。
translation: Every day, those nursemaids washed themselves in scented baths and applied a wonderful scent with all kinds of adornment as they approached the king.

source_sentence: 王乃抱持太子安於膝上，觀看相貌甚大歡喜。
translation: The king then took the prince in his arms and placed him on his lap, and he was greatly delighted when he looked at his features.

source_sentence: 國有常法：若王宮生子，即喚梵行相師觀看相貌。
translation: There was a common rule in the kingdom that if a child was born in the king's palace, he would call a priestly fortune teller to examine his features.

source_sentence: 王乃喚相人令占大子，既占相已而答王曰：『今此太子，實是成就三十二相。
translation: The king then summoned the fortune teller to divine the eldest son, and after divining his features, he answered the king, 'Now, this prince has really accomplished the thirty-two marks.

source_sentence: 若在家者，得作金輪聖王，王四天下善法理化，具有七寶：一者金輪寶、二者象寶、三者馬寶、四者末尼寶、五者女寶、六者主藏臣寶、七者兵將寶，具足千子，勇健端嚴降伏他軍。
translation: If he were at home, he would be a golden-wheeled sage king who trains in the principle of good qualities throughout the four worlds and possesses seven treasures: a golden-wheel treasure, an elephant treasure, a horse treasure, a mani treasure, a woman treasure, a lord's store and minister's treasure, and a general's treasure, all complete with a thousand sons who are strong and dignified enough to subdue other armies.

source_sentence: 此大地中所有人等無相犯者，皆悉令行勝妙善法。
translation: All the people in this great land who don't transgress each other are made to practice excellent and wonderful good qualities.

source_sentence: 若當出家得法王位，如來、應、正等覺，名稱普聞具三十二相。』
translation: If they leave home and attain the position of king of the Dharma, the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One will be universally heard by name and will have thirty-two characteristics.'

source_sentence: 王即問曰：『何者是其三十二大丈夫相？』
translation: The king then asked, 'What are those thirty-two marks of a great personage?'

source_sentence: 『一者具大丈夫足善安住等案地相；二者於雙足下現千輻輪相；三者具大丈夫纖長指；四者足跟趺圓長；五者手足細軟；六者手足網縵；七者垂手摩膝相；八者醫泥邪[蹲-酋+(十/田/ㄙ)]相；九者身不僂曲；十者勢峯藏密；十一者身相圓滿如尼瞿陀樹相；十二者常光一尋；十三者身毛上靡；十四者身諸毛孔一一毛生，如紺青色螺文右旋；十五者身皮金色；十六者身皮細滑塵垢不著；十七者於其身上兩手兩足兩肩及項七處圓滿；十八者其身上半如師子王；十九者肩善圓滿；二十者髆間充實；二十一者身洪健直；二十二者具四十齒皆悉齊平；二十三者其齒無隙；二十四者其齒鮮白；二十五者頷如師子；二十六者其舌廣薄若從口出普覆面輪至耳髮際；二十七者於諸味中得最上味；二十八者得大梵音言詞和雅能悅眾意，譬如羯羅頻迦之音，其聲雷震猶如天鼓；二十九者其目紺青；三十者睫如牛王；三十一者其頂上現烏率膩沙；三十二者眉間毫相，其色光白螺文右旋。

translation: If he doesn't leave home, he'll attain the four continents of the wheel-turning sage king.'

source_sentence: 「菩薩常法：其菩薩母產菩薩已，七日命終生三十三天。
translation: "The constant rule for bodhisattvas is that after their mother gives birth to a bodhisattva, she's born in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven when her life ends in seven days.

source_sentence: 菩薩常法：生已其身端嚴，超諸世間，眾所愛樂見者無厭，猶如善巧工人以閻浮檀金作諸形像，天衣覆上放大光明普遍暉耀。
translation: The bodhisattva's constant rule: After birth, his body is so dignified that it transcends the world and is loved by everyone who sees it without tire, like a skilled worker who makes images of gold from jambu trees and covers them with heavenly robes that shine with a brilliant, universal light.

source_sentence: 其菩薩身亦復如是，如彼蓮花眾人所愛，菩薩亦爾。
translation: The bodhisattva's body is likewise, like that lotus flower that's loved by many people, and so is the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 菩薩常法：眼恒不眴，如三十三天。
translation: The bodhisattva's constant rule is that his eyes are always dazzling, like the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 由果業故，日夜常見四維上下一由旬內，梵音深遠，如雪山鳥其聲清妙。
translation: As a result of their actions, they often see the four dimensions up and down within a leap of a second day and night, and their Brahmā voice is as profound as a snowy mountain bird with a clear, beautiful sound.

source_sentence: 菩薩生已，自然具足廣大智慧，善解一切世間正化，父王國法無不明了。
translation: After being born, the bodhisattva naturally possesses vast wisdom, skillfully understands all the world's right teachings, and has no unclear understanding of his father's kingdom or the Dharma.

source_sentence: 「爾時那羅陀仙人來白師曰：『今者菩薩入劫比羅城，父王淨飯已立三號，願師共詣禮拜瞻仰。』
translation: "It was then that the sage Narada came to the teacher and said, 'Now, the bodhisattva has entered Kapila's city, and the father-king has established three names for his pure abode, so may I ask the teacher to come with him to venerate and respect him.'

source_sentence: 其師謂曰：『今隨汝意。』
translation: His teacher said, 'Now, do as you wish.'

source_sentence: 二仙相隨欲修禮謁，以菩薩力故遂失神通，不得如常乘空而去，便共步往劫比羅城。
translation: The two sages followed him, wanting to pay homage, but because of the power of the bodhisattva, they lost their psychic abilities and couldn't ride off in the air as usual, so they both walked to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 既入城已至王門外，告門人曰：『汝可為我往白大王，阿私陀仙今來門外，願見大王。』
translation: After entering the city, they went to the king's gate and told the gatekeeper, 'You can tell the king for me that the sage Asita is here at the gate, wishing to see the king.'

source_sentence: 時守門人即至王所，具陳上事。
translation: The gatekeeper then went to the king and explained the above.

source_sentence: 王聞是已，即持香花迎彼二仙，安置宮內。
translation: After hearing this, the king brought incense and flowers to welcome the two sages and placed them inside the palace.

source_sentence: 既安置已善言問訊：『今者大仙，何緣遠來？
translation: After they were installed, he spoke well and asked, 'Why did this great sage come so far?'

source_sentence: 欲求何事？』
translation: What is it that you seek?'

source_sentence: 二仙答曰：『我等故來願見菩薩。』
translation: The two sages answered, 'We've come to see the bodhisattva because of this.'

source_sentence: 王報仙曰：『我之大子今正安眠，且待須臾令與相見。』
translation: The king then rewarded the sages, saying, 'My eldest son is sleeping now, so we'll wait a moment to see him.'

source_sentence: 爾時二仙復白王曰：『雖復未覺，我等意者暫欲觀瞻。』
translation: The two sages then again said to the king, 'Even though we haven't yet awakened, we would like to look at them for a while.'

source_sentence: 爾時大王即領二仙至菩薩所，便見菩薩，雖復寢睡其眼常開。
translation: The king then led the two sages to the bodhisattva and they saw him, and although he was still asleep, his eyes were always open.

source_sentence: 時阿私陀仙見是事已，即說頌曰：「『如真飛龍馬，　　暫睡還復覺；　　如善營事人，　　睡蓋不能覆。』
translation: Seeing this, the Sage Asita spoke a verse, saying, 'Like a true flying dragon or horse, it awakens again after a moment of sleep; like a person who works well, the hood of sleep can't cover it.'

source_sentence: 「時彼嬭母即前捧抱太子授彼二仙，時阿私陀便以雙手跪而承受遍體觀察，白大王曰：『大王已令諸婆羅門占相師等相太子未？』
translation: "When that mother went forward to carry the prince in her arms and give him to the two sages, Asita knelt down with his hands, took him up and looked at him whole, and said to the king, 'Has the king told the brāhmaṇas and fortune tellers to look at the prince yet?'

source_sentence: 父王答曰：『已令相訖。』
translation: The father replied, 'I've made the marks complete.'

source_sentence: 阿私陀仙復白王曰：『彼等諸人，占此太子當有何相？』
translation: Again, Asita replied to the king, 'What do they think the prince will look like?'

source_sentence: 父王報曰：『若紹國位，御金輪寶，聲聞十方一切國土。』
translation: His father rewarded him, 'Suppose he were to assume the position of king and were to control the gold wheel and jewels, and he were to hear of all the lands in the ten directions.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀以贊頌曰：「『大王今當知！
translation: Asita then spoke in praise, saying, 'Now, Great King, you must know!

source_sentence: 相者不能測，　　末劫無輪王，　　必證菩提道。
translation: 'That man's features are unfathomable, for there will be no wheel-turning king in the final age who will surely realize the path to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 一切金輪王，　　相猶不炳著，　　我今觀太子，　　當取法王位。』
translation: While all gold wheel-turning kings still have their characteristics unattached, I now see that the prince will assume the position of Dharma king.'
